title: QUICKSILVER
author: Callie Hart
description: Saeris is transported to a dangerous land of ice and snow, where she must contend with a Fae warrior who has suspect agendas.

title: THE SURROGATE MOTHER
author: Freida McFadden
description: Abby’s personal assistant, who offers to be her surrogate, also carries an unspeakable secret.

title: THE END OF THE WORLD AS WE KNOW IT
author: Christopher Golden and Brian Keene
description: A short story anthology based on Stephen King’s 1978 novel “The Stand.”

title: LOVE ARRANGED
author: Lauren Asher
description: The third book in the Lakefront Billionaires series. Lily and Lorenzo’s fake relationship comes with baggage.

title: ON WINGS OF BLOOD
author: Briar Boleyn
description: A dragon rider named Medra Pendragon is captured by vampires and placed inside the dangerous Bloodwing Academy.

title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE
author: Bessel van der Kolk
description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.

title: THE ANXIOUS GENERATION
author: Jonathan Haidt
description: A co-author of “The Coddling of the American Mind” looks at the mental health impacts that a phone-based life has on children.

title: THE IDAHO FOUR
author: James Patterson and Vicky Ward
description: Investigations into the murders of four University of Idaho students on Nov. 13, 2022.

title: ON POWER
author: Mark R. Levin
description: The Fox News host considers various facets of power and its effect on history.

title: BLACK AF HISTORY
author: Michael Harriot
description: A columnist at TheGrio.com articulates moments in American history that center the perspectives and experiences of Black Americans.

title: DON'T BELIEVE EVERYTHING YOU THINK, EXPANDED EDITION
author: Joseph Nguyen

title: THE PARKINSON'S PLAN
author: Ray Dorsey and Michael S. Okun

title: WONDER
author: R.J. Palacio
description: A boy with a facial deformity starts school. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: REFUGEE
author: Alan Gratz
description: Three children in three different conflicts look for safe haven. (Ages 9 to 12)

title: IMPOSSIBLE CREATURES
author: Katherine Rundell. Illustrated Ashley Mackenzie
description: A young boy is enlisted to save a place where magical creatures reside. (Ages 10 and up)

title: ODDER
author: Katherine Applegate. Illustrated Charles Santoso
description: After a shark attack, Odder recuperates at the aquarium with the scientists who raised her. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: THE MISFITS: A ROYAL CONUNDRUM
author: Lisa Yee. Illustrated Dan Santat
description: Olive is sent to Reforming Arts School and teams up with a group of crime-fighting outcasts. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: THE SMART COOKIE
author: Jory John. Illustrated Pete Oswald
description: Cookie builds up her self-confidence. (Ages 4 to 8)

title: LITTLE BLUE TRUCK AND RACER RED
author: Alice Schertle. Illustrated Jill McElmurry
description: Red challenges Blue to a race. (Ages 4 to 8)

title: THE WONDERFUL THINGS YOU WILL BE
author: Emily Winfield Martin
description: A celebration of future possibilities. (Ages 3 to 7)

title: CHICKA CHICKA TRICKA TREAT
author: Julien Chung
description: The alphabet letters climb the creaky old tree for Halloween. (Ages 4 to 8)

title: DRAGONS LOVE TACOS
author: Adam Rubin. Illustrated Daniel Salmieri
description: What to serve your dragon-guests. (Ages 3 to 5)

title: THE SUMMER I TURNED PRETTY TRILOGY
author: Jenny Han
description: A beach house, summer love and enduring friendships. (Ages 12 and up)

title: THE HUNGER GAMES
author: Suzanne Collins
description: In a dystopia, a girl fights for survival on live TV. (Ages 12 and up)

title: PERCY JACKSON & THE OLYMPIANS
author: Rick Riordan
description: A boy battles mythological monsters. (Ages 9 to 12)

title: HARRY POTTER
author: J.K. Rowling
description: A wizard hones his conjuring skills in the service of fighting evil. (Ages 10 and up)

title: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID
author: Jeff Kinney. Illustrated Jeff Kinney
description: The travails and challenges of adolescence. (Ages 9 to 12)

title: HOUR OF THE PUMPKIN QUEEN
author: Megan Shepherd
description: After a potion demonstration goes awry, Sally and Luna fall through a portal to Time Town. (Ages 12 and up)

title: A THEORY OF DREAMING
author: Ava Reid
description: In the sequel to "A Study in Drowning," Effy and Preston return to the University of Llyr. (Ages 14 and up)

title: GLORIOUS RIVALS
author: Jennifer Lynn Barnes
description: The stakes are raised for the seven players on Hawthorne Island. (Ages 12 to 18)

title: NOTHING LIKE THE MOVIES
author: Lynn Painter
description: In this sequel to "Better Than the Movies," Wes tries to win back the heart of Liz. (Ages 14 and up)

title: IMMORTAL CONSEQUENCES
author: I.V. Marie
description: At Blackwood Academy, six students compete to change their fate in a cutthroat magical competition called the Decennial. (Ages 14 and up)
